title: The Foundry 2015 Grenache Noir (Stellenbosch)
description: This opens with a gorgeous, highly aromatic nose reminiscent of purple flower fields partnered with ripe raspberry, blueberry and blackberry. The fruit-forward palate offers more berry goodness, with a velvety tannic structure and enough acidity to enliven the finish. Drink now–2019.

title: Trenel Fils 2016 Les Capitans  (Juliénas)
description: From the sector known as Les Capitans on the edge of the village, this wine is produced from vines up to 120 years old. Like other wines from this producer, it offers a mint and herbal character as well as ripe fruit. The wood aging and acidity contribute the richness of the aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

title: Turnbull 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, round and silky, this is an approachable, relatively light-bodied wine that doesn't shirk on underlying brawn. Moderate structure maintains a fresh, focused likability as slightly spicy oak hits hardest and most pleasantly on the finish.

title: Van Loveren 2015 Christina The Heritage Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Western Cape)
description: Dusty cocoa and charred coconut are front and center on the nose of this decadent pour, supported by notes of jammy berry preserves and violets. The tannins lend ample structure, yet are fine and well-integrated into the ripe fruit flavors. Final notes of green peppercorn and tobacco leaf lend a pleasant herbal and earthy send-off to the sip. Drink now–2021.

title: Viña Chocalan 2013 Vitrum Red (Maipo Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah-led blend opens with blackened oak, vanilla and blackberry aromas. A deep strong palate is not shy with tannins, while this tastes a bit woody, with herbal, spicy black-fruit notes. A dense peppery finish is texturally solid.

title: Aiola 2013 Cancello Rosso Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 5% Colorino, this has aromas suggesting cassis, leather and a touch of cedar. The juicy palate doles out black cherry, clove and tobacco set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.

title: Colle Bereto 2013 Il Convento Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: The subtle nose of this 100% Sangiovese suggests aromas of tilled earth, baking spice and black-skinned berry. The linear palate offers black cherry, licorice, clove and a hint of ripe raspberry alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Enjoy though 2025.

title: Collin-Bourisset 2015 Moulin-à-Vent des Hospices Civils de Romanèche-Thorins  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: This bright purple wine, still very young, is sold to raise funds for a local hospital. It is rich and packed with firm tannins as well as succulent black fruit. This powerful wine needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
designation: Moulin-à-Vent des Hospices Civils de Romanèche-Thorins

title: David Bruce 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned red fruit is complemented by citrus-squeezed vibrancy in this full-bodied red, that presents as fleshy on the palate. A grit of oak adds power to the lengthy spicy finish.

title: Di Bruno 2016 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)
description: Almost as pale as water in color, this is a fascinating wine. It starts with aromas of sweet peach blossom, candied tangerine rinds, honeysuckle and white rocks. There is a flash of sweetness on the zippy palate, but it quickly dissipates into a floral Asian pear-laced flavor profile. It is a perfect pairing for sushi.

title: Domaine de Colonat 2016 Les Charmes Tradition  (Morgon)
description: Oak aging has given this otherwise intensely fruity wine extra richness. It adds spice to the red-berry fruits and bright acidity. Concentration from the 65-year-old vines intensifies tannin and enhances the fruitiness of this wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Domaine de Nalys 2015 White (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Waxy lemon peels and dusty mineral notes lend a savory feel to this medium-bodied white. Red apple and pear notes are more muted than fresh, but highlighted by fresh lemon acidity and lingering salinity on the finish.

title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016  Côte de Brouilly
description: This is a delicious wine, full of structured fruit. Acidity and bright cherry flavors are given shape and density by the concentration of old vines and the dry core of tannin. Drink this balanced wine now.

title: Castle Rock 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Vibrant blackberry aromas leap from the glass on this bottling, which also offers anise, violet and dried meat aromas. The palate combines smashed black currants with black pepper and violets, wrapped together by serious tannins.

title: Château Beauchêne 2014 Cuvée de la Serrière Grenache-Syrah (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: While plush with ripe blueberry and cherry flavors, this full-bodied, warming red has tinges of freshly tilled earth, garrigue and spice. It's not concentrated but easy drinking and fresh. The finish is moderately long, ending in slightly tacky but fine-grained tannins.

title: Château de Javernand 2016 Indigène  (Chiroubles)
description: The name of this cuvée refers to the natural yeast used in fermentation. Bottled without added sulfur, the wine is soft with a direct line of juicy acidity. It is a complex, structured wine with some firm tannins. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2015 Brolio Bettino  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, mint and cooking spice abound on this 90% Sangiovese and 10% Colorino blend. The medium-bodied, juicy palate offers ripe black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and clove alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2015 Rocca Guicciarda Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Red-skinned berry, dark spice and balsamic aromas are front and center on this structured red. The firm, savory palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and grilled herb alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Bella Grace 2014 Grenache Noir (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Gripping in texture and nicely saturated with ripe plum and smoked meat flavors, this is a compelling, interesting and complex wine. It shows light oaky, toasted accents on top of vivid red cherry and black-cherry flavors, while firm tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.

title: Bella Grace 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Dark but friendly fruit flavors seem to saturate this medium-bodied wine, showing admirable concentration on the palate and good length on the aftertaste. Blueberry, boysenberry and mild spices give it lots to like. The wine is 100% varietal and has a firm texture without obvious tannins.

title: Bevela 2014 Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: A bit lighter in color than the typical Syrah, this wine, which comes in a squat wide bottle, shows strawberry, roasted fennel and a savory smoke quality on the nose. There's a bountiful burst of acidity at the tip of the sip, followed by a spice rack of flavors that give depth to the light, slightly sour red-currant fruit. It's very tangy on the finish.
designation: Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard

title: Borgo Salcetino 2013 Lucarello Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: French oak, espresso, toast, coconut, underbrush and spiced plum aromas carry over to the assertive palate along with cranberry, star anise and dried sage. Flexed, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide firm support.

title: Boudreaux Cellars 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)
description: This wine comes from a number of top sites, including Bacchus, Champoux, Loess and Seven Hills. Pleasing aromas of graphite, spice, fresh herb, whole green pepper and earth lead to light fresh-feeling fruit and savory flavors. It shows a lovely sense of balance. This was a cool, particularly challenging vintage for the state but this wine succeeds on many levels.

title: Cafaggio 2013 San Martino Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Underbrush, cassis and star anise aroma follow over to the firm palate together with dried Morello cherry, espresso, powdered sage and a hint of tobacco. Tightly stretched, close-grained tannins leave an assertive, slightly astringent finish. Give the tannins a few years to unclench then drink up.

title: Calcu 2014 Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Heavy oak makes for a rooty-smelling wine with aromas of clove and Old Spice fragrance. A firm drying palate delivers an intense oaky attack, while this tastes of forest berries, clove and wood spice. A powerful finish ensures that this will last a while. Drink through 2024.

title: Castelli del Grevepesa 2012 Castello di Bibbione Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Mature black-skinned berry, exotic spice, baked plum and menthol aromas lead the nose while the ripe palate offers dried black cherry, prune, clove, toast and a hint of dried sage. Close-grained tannins provide firm support while a blast of orange zest brightens the finish.

title: Château des Coccinelles 2016 Roussanne-Grenache Blanc (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Orange blossoms and citrus peels waft from this lavish, full-bodied blend of Roussanne and Grenache Blanc. It's silky and rich in mouthfeel but crisp white grapefruit and lemon flavors lend freshness to the palate. The finish lingers with hints of white peach and lime pith. Drink now through 2020.

title: Domaine Chasselay 2016 Eparcieux  (Beaujolais Blanc)
description: This limited-production wine from old vines is aged in wood, giving it a rich character by adding hints of toast while also enhancing the fruit. It's a ripe wine that will likely age. Drink now for its young, fruity character or age until late 2018.

title: Cafaggio 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Crushed mint, dried red berry, underbrush and new leather aromas lift out of the glass. The lithe, straightforward palate offers dried cherry, grilled herb and a white pepper note set against polished tannins. Vibrant acidity lends balance.

title: Capannelle 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: This 100% Sangiovese shows varietal aromas of underbrush, black-skinned berry and a whiff of leather. The tight, savory palate delivers tobacco, white pepper and Morello cherry set against fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2025.
